page.title: 18FARMING IN MARSTON VALE
page.content: FARMS ARE MOSTLY ARABLE WITH BARLEY AND WHEAT BEING THE MAIN CROP. SUGAR BEET AND OIL SEED RAPE ARE BASIC ROTATION CROPS WITH RAPE INCREASING IN POPULARITY. THERE ARE SMALL AREAS OF POTATOES,BEANS AND PEAS BUT NO HORTICULTURE OR GLASSHOUSE PRODUCTION. THE AREA HAS TWO MILKING HERDS OF 120 PLUS COWS AND A FLOCK OF 350 PLUS SHEEP. GRASSLAND PRODUCTION IN GENERAL IS STATIC-IN AREA EXCEPT EXTRA LAND BROUGHT IN AGRICULTURE FROM EXHAUSTED CLAY PITS. THERE IS A SMALL LIVESTOCK MARKET IN BEDFORD AND A LARGER ONE IN NORTHAMPTON. MOST SMALL FIELDS HAVE BEEN OPENED UP INTO LARGE AREAS WITH TRACTOR POWER IN EXCESS OF 240 HORSE-POWER.TRACKED VEHICLES ARE USED ON THE HEAVIER SOILS. THE AVERAGE MANPOWER ON LARGE ARABLE FARMS IS ONE MAN TO 500 ACRES. AGRICULTURE EMPLOYS A LOW PERCENTAGE OF LOCAL WORK FORCE.
